title: How do I use GitHub Pages?
summary: GitHub is a "social coding" site. It allows you to upload code repositories for storage in the Git version control system. You can then collaborate on code projects, and the system is open-source by default, meaning that anyone in the world can find your GitHub code, use it, learn from it, and improve on it. You can do that with other people's code too! This article provides a basic guide to publishing content using GitHub's gh-pages feature.
short_title: How do I use GitHub Pages?
